required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine Eligibility for CAH-301 (A Study of Gene Therapy for Classic Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia (CAH) [NCT04783181])
clinical_study.official_title: Pre-screening Study to Identify Adult Participants With Classic Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia Due to 21-Hydroxylase Deficiency Who May Be Eligible for Treatment in the CAH-301 Trial With BBP-631, an Adeno-associated Virus (AAV) Serotype 5-Based Recombinant Vector Encoding the Human CYP21A2 Gene

brief_summary.textblock: This pre-screening study is designed to determine potential eligibility of adults with classic CAH due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency (21-OHD) for participation in the CAH-301 [NCT04783181] gene therapy trial with BBP-631.

detailed_description.textblock: Adult participants diagnosed with classic CAH due to 21-OHD and who are taking glucocorticoids as treatment for CAH will undergo assessments to determine their potential eligibility for participation in the adult CAH-301 treatment trial with BBP-631.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Potentially Eligible for CAH-301 Study

arm_group.description: Participants will undergo antibody and genetic screen, initial pre-screening, eligibility monitoring and eligibility confirmation for potential transition to the treatment trial center once a treatment assignment in the study CAH-301 becomes available. Participation in Study CAH-300 is permitted to continue until treatment assignment is available in the treatment trial or unless, during eligibility monitoring or eligibility

study_pop.textblock: Adult participants diagnosed with classic CAH due to 21-OHD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male and non-pregnant females with classic CAH (simple virilizing or salt-wasting) due to 21-OHD
- Screening/baseline 17-OHP levels > 5-10 × ULN
- Is on a daily regimen of glucocorticoid
- Naïve to prior gene therapy or AAV-mediated therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Positive for anti-AAV5 antibodies
- History of adrenalectomy and has no significant liver disease
